Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, GRS said:

Thanks...still...i wonder what counts as "KSC Biome", but i'll try working on it again...

I've not updated them since KSP 1.6.1, but I believe the information on KSC biomes on sheet 2 of my KSP Science Checklists is still accurate.

@Chequers I humbly submit my contribution to this challenge 

I present Flyer 1 (a rather unimaginative name I apologise  ). This simple two stage rocket (costing 3150 credits) consists of a single solid rocket booster and a single liquid fuel stage and is composed of only 7 parts. Additionally I have also drained the pod of all monopropellant. There's no heat shield as in all honesty I forgot about it  ! I'm aiming to land near the mountains as I've never been there before. 

 

Flyer 1 bravely ascending through the atmosphere 

Beginning gravity turn. The valiant Valentina remains remarkably calm throughout this ordeal 

 

Solid Rocket Booster has been separated and Flyer 1 is now climbing to orbit on a single Terrier engine 

 

Yes! Victory is achieved with a stable orbit 

 

Reentry sequence begins 

 

Valentina and the Flyer 1 Capsule gently drift down towards the Kerbin Mountains near the KSC 

 

A successful mission concluded Valentina now awaits to be rescued 

Edited June 10, 2020 by Venturer2Space
Additional detail added to description

@Chequers I was wondering when you say landing inside a KSC biome does the light green grass surrounding the KSC count? 

Edited June 10, 2020 by Venturer2Space

Flyer 3 (Not quite sure why I missed out Flyer 2...) 

I again humbly present my attempt at this challenge. This time I'm looking to (try to) accomplish 5 things: Zircon Chevron, Silver Claw, Onyx Eyes, Amber Leaves and a Vermilion Heart. This two stage rocket designated "Flyer 3" is composed of 10 (Tier 4 and below) parts exactly, costing 4768 credits, is capable of carrying two kerbals and is also equipped with a barometer. 

 

Our brave explorers Valentina and Rovis are loaded into this contraption 

 

Beginning gravity turn 

 

 

Solid Rocket Booster Separation achieved. The second stage continues to orbit on its Terrier engine 

 

Orbit achieved !!!  

 

Rovis conducts some experiments with the barometer before quickly heading back inside 

 

Reentry sequence begins. The capsule plunges through the atmosphere. I had hoped to land a little bit closer to the KSC but oh well...  

 

 

Flyer 3 drifts back to Kerbin dangling on a parachute and safely lands with its precious cargo of kerbals and one piece of science data 

 

Thanks for reading!!  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Edited June 10, 2020 by Venturer2Space
Modified the font :)

@GRS, congratulations on updating your entry with an impressive landing back at KSC - we all knew you could do it, and were standing by to firmly plant the Crossed Swords adornment onto your Kerbin Crescent. With this fifth adornment, you earn the 1st Class Insignia, and a place on the prestigious 1st Class Register. Well done!

---

@Venturer2Space, we awoke to find not one, but two submissions in quick succession from you! Some might call that 'reckless haste', but not us! We at the OBC Committee like that pioneering spirit... but won't ask any questions about what happened to Flyer 2... 

On to the honours: With your first entry, Flyer 1, you successfully pass our of Orbit Boot Camp, and are hereby awarded the Kerbin Crescent, adorned with Zircon Chevron, Amber Leaves and Onyx Eyes. Congratulations - your name and vessel will be recorded on the Honour Roll. You are also welcome to display the OBC patch in your signature if you wish.

Your second entry, Flyer 3, is a veritable demonstration of Orbital prowess; thank you for the detailed screenshot mission report. It is awarded the Zircon Chevron, Silver Claw (with Meteorologist Ribbon), Onyx Eyes, Amber Leaves and Vermilion Heart. For achieving five additional adornments in a single launch, you are awarded the 1st Class Insignia: your name and vessel will be recorded on the 1st Class Register. Well done!

 

Edited June 10, 2020 by Chequers
Thanks mate. The 2nd Craft was a lot harder to fly because of the stacked capsule configuration

ItThis is my second try the craft name is I think I can v2. Total cost is 6822 total parts recoverd was 1823. For total of 4,999. I also did a temp reading for a Kelvin Ribbon. I did all of it camping to Boot to.

@Keithv708, congratulations on your entry - 'I Think I Can V2', and for just squeaking in under the cost limit, with 4,999. We at the OBC committee like to see engineers squeeze every last drop of efficiency out of their 5k budget, so well done!

You successfully pass out of Orbit Boot Camp, and are awarded the Kerbin Crescent, adorned with Silver Claw (with Kelvin Ribbon). Huzzah! Your name and vessel will be recorded on the Honour Roll, and you may display the OBC Signature Patch if you choose to. Thanks for taking part!

Edited July 8, 2020 by Chequers

My very unoriginal attempt...

Definitely redoing this sometime, but this works for now.

Sorry for submitting number two so quickly... Really couldn't hold myself. Another not so original design.

Recovered 1750, reducing the cost to 4820 (I'm assuming the payload counts as lost as well)

@Comte_Snek, welcome to OBC - and thank you for submitting two entries, with detailed screenshot mission reports to boot!

Your first entry, 'Le Garbage', is a timeless design, with the pointy bit aimed skywards - a great demonstration of how to make things go up quickly. With this vessel, you succesfully pass out of Orbit Boot Camp, and are hereby awarded the Kerbin Crescent, adorned with Zircon Chevron, Silver Claw (with Meteorologist Ribbon), Amber Leaves, and Onyx Eyes. Congratulations!

Your second entry, 'Le Garbage 2' does a lot with a little! We were particularly impressed at the amount of payload you were able to get into orbit - including two Kerbals and a satellite. We also enjoyed that the lower of the two command pods doubles up as an underwater viewing platform upon splashdown. Very creative. This entry is adorned with Vermilion Heart and Cobalt Stripe. Congratulations!

Your name and vessels will be recorded on the Honour Roll, and you may use the OBC patch in your signature if you like. Thanks for taking part! 

Edited July 10, 2020 by Chequers

Update

Thanks to everyone who took part in this challenge - I was blown away by all the submissions, creativity and boundary pushing brilliance. I learned a lot about maximising efficiency and cost - and it was a lot of fun to view your creations!

I feel this challenge has run its course for now, so I won't be actively monitoring this challenge thread; if you decide to submit an entry, be prepared to wait a while to get your name on the board.

Of course, if anybody would like to reboot this challenge, go right ahead!

Thanks,

Chequers

On 8/1/2020 at 8:36 PM, Chequers said:

I feel this challenge has run its course for now, so I won't be actively monitoring this challenge thread; if you decide to submit an entry, be prepared to wait a while to get your name on the board.

Well crap, I just signed up for this to be my first challenge. In fact, this is my first ever post.

I didn't look at other designs here, so sorry if this is copied. It made several attempts and most were stricken with coming in too hot while under parachute. I finally decided to try to have an asymmetrical design with parachutes on one side and modular girder segment on other to take the landing (allows 80m/s!). In previous attempts, I added a drogue chute to stabilize decent under parachute. In my successful attempt, I tried without drogue to get launch under 5,000. It was very perilous without because it teetered violently under main chute. I had also lost all electric charge so maybe it would have been easier had I saved some juice for SAS right at touchdown.

I think I either just made 1st class, or slightly missed it with KSC biome, which I guess I could reattempt.

Launch cost: 4,918

Recovered:  4,096

Mission cost: 822

Distance from KSC: 1.8km (97.9%) - Does this count as KSC biome?

Parts: 9

Science: Thermometer

Highest tech: I don't know how to tell this, but I think highest tech part is small nose cone and FL-T800? 

 

Spoiler

 

VAB ready to go at cost of 4,918:

I didn't screen capture ascent, my screenshot hotkeys mess with throttle/steering:

EVA with Thermometer:

De-orbit burn complete and trajectory shown. Notice 13 m/s to spare:

Coming in hot, roll to protect girders:

Chute deployed but not open. I had used that 13 m/s up but maybe just a tad too much as I am going to come up just short of KSC proper:

Chute opened, this still shot does not show the violent teetering motion while suspended under one chute. I'm puckering at this point:

To my surprise and luck, I landed on girders while teetering, but enough to not lose parts. I tipped off girders, but intact: 

Proof of science:

Proof of recovery and 4,918 - 4,096 = 822 cost

Welcome, @krautfed1. Thank you for submitting an entry. It's typical that I bring OBC to a close due to inactivity, and a new entrant arrives on the scene! OBC lives on!

Thanks for providing a detailed mission report and screenshots for your entry, 'Orbit Boot Camp 1', and congratulations for going above and beyond to earn those additional adornments on your maiden flight!

You successfully pass out of Orbit Boot Camp, and are hereby awarded the Kerbin Crescent, adorned with Zircon Chevron, Silver Claw (with Kelvin Ribbon) and Amber Leaves.

Unfortunately, the small nose cone is a Tier 5 technology part, so this entry does not qualify for the Onyx Eyes. Furthermore a KSC Biome for the Crossed Swords is any biome where conducting a crew report would state that it is from 'The KSC/The Launchpad/The VAB/The Runway/etc'. 

Still, a hearty congratulations on your first entry - and do feel free to continue chasing additional adornments; we at OBC thoroughly enjoy 1st Class Entries.

Your name and vessel (feel free to give it a more unique name if you like) will be recorded on the Honour Roll. You are also welcome to display the OBC Patch in your signature if you wish.

Edited August 5, 2020 by Chequers

@Chequers Thank you for the welcome. I'm hooked on Challenges now.

Bummed I missed the extras, I went back for tweaks and SUCCESS! I ditched asymmetrical but stuck to the design of having modular girders take the landing even at 11 m/s under chute. I love using these girders and I'm very sloppy at landing. I had a dozen attempts at this and finally realized I was trying to do it with Goo Canister and it was just throwing me off on decent. Switched back to thermometer and viola, better re-entry control. So much control that I could fairly easily steer to KSC to fine tune. I landed on the runway and did a crew report for good measure of my landing location. I'm crossing my fingers that I made 1st Class. Also, if I made 1st Class does that make this one of the lowest mission costs in 1st Class?

Launch cost: 4,710

Recovered:  3,976

Mission cost: 734

Distance from KSC: Runway baby!

Parts: 10

Science: Thermometer

Spoiler

From the VAB, pretty simple design.

Didn't get ascent... my screen capture has SHIFT and messes with throttle. Here's orbit, not as circular as I like but its LKO!

Coming home:

Pretty scenic final re-entry. Mun-rise, KSC, shores/islands, mountains, city.

Chute deployed and this time I saved some electricity for SAS stabilization upon touchdown.

On runway, SAS stabilized 

Crew report on runway

Report proof of purchase:

 

Edited August 6, 2020 by krautfed1

I knew you'd go for another entry, @krautfed1 - and I'm glad you did, because it's excellent.

It's impressive to see you take learnings from your first entry, and using that as a platform to create an improved vessel. Thank you for another detailed screenshot mission report. Onto the honours:

Your entry, 'Orbit Boot Camp 3.0', is awarded the Zircon Chevron, Silver Claw (with Kelvin Ribbon), Amber Leaves, Onyx Eyes and Crossed Swords. For achieving five additional adornments in a single launch, you earn the 1st Class Insignia.

Your name and vessel will be recorded on the prestigious 1st Class Register - congratulations!

@Chequers Upon looking at this, I need to disqualify myself from Onyx Eyes, for now.  As you see in my recovered parts list, I used FL-T800 fuel tanks, which I believe fall into same Tier 5 as small nose cone in previous attempt.

I just built a Orbit Boot Camp 4.0 replacing the FL-T800's with FL-T400's and with same Delta-V as OBC 3.0 and it comes to cost of 5,110. I then replaced a FL-T400 with reduced fuel with FL-T200 and I'm able to get a little more Delta-V. Doing so, I'm left with 3,323 m/s in VAB vs the 3,525 m/s I had in OBC 3.0. Reducing the fuel (weight) also made TWR go up in VAB from 2.10 to 2.32. So maaaaybe I can still accomplish this feat, but I'll have to try at a later date.

For now, I relinquish my 1st Class and Onyx Eyes.

@krautfed1 - it's that kind of honourable honesty that we appreciate here at OBC! 

We'll certainly be keeping a spot warm on the 1st Class Register for when you come back with your third entry!

2 hours ago, Chequers said:

Or just add part variants/skins? 

This.

It just completely recolors every part assuming restock+ isn't installed.

Okay @Chequers, I've got an entry for you.

Presenting the Cheapo!

Launch price of 4733 and 10 parts.

In orbit (the launch was very difficult and I forgot to get any pictures of it)

Don't worry, I only used Mech Jeb to look at the vessel info.

Almost perfectly circular.

Now for reentry:

And landing:

And touchdown:

The cost of the craft was 1599 (cost without fuel)  and using the recovery cost formula on the wiki (0.98-(distance/2150) I calculated that the recovery cost was1264.

Launch cost of 4733 - Zircon Chevron

Recovery total of 3469

Exactly 10 parts - Amber Leaves

All parts are tech level 3 or below - Onyx Eyes

Edited September 4, 2020 by Kerminator1000
